title: The Web Browser Personalization with the Client Side Triplestore

author: Hitoshi Uchida, World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)

segmentation: I wish to see Wichita from Canon ink and and also I was a member of the W 3C.
The title is web browser Parcelization with client side Triple Star.
Before explaining my motivation, there is 2 issues in the current web system.
First one is outside of current websites.

Thanks to the productive web services, we can do everything with the web browsers for examples of creating the documentation or presentation about scheduling email and the photo on the photo sharing and SMS communication.
However, we don't have.
We don't have not enough options to mashup and utilize our user data among services.
So current standard ways to use boost protocol, like the right size of figures.

So if the if the server does not support the old protocol, it means we cannot get the user data from the server side and the general user don't pay attention to Fitch, Fitch user data are still open to the all servers.
And other issue is user data centralization on third parties.

So currently is a web browser has a much innovative technologies like rendering rich graphic web pages with CSS and real Time Transfer protocol with Speedy or Websocket and video streaming is also available and client data storage with web storage on the index DB.
However we strongly depends on the quality of the third party services to control our personal data.
On the web, becausw web browser does not have ability to control about user data on web browsers, so it is just web application execution.
And as you know, and only after disclosing our private data, we can utilize on the web.
So the web browser has like this in the bottom figure.
So much standardized technology but no function to control our user data.
So what we want to achieve is fast wise I would like to mash up user data without disclosing our private data and personalized browsing experiences with semantic web technology.
So I created the two software.
One is a triple store JavaScript library on HTML5 Web Stretch API feeds correct personal semantic data into web browser during browsing and the next one is a web browser.
Personalized programming feature is Google Chrome extension.
That is called semantic spider, which enhance user experiences on web browsers with utilizing collective personal semantic data.

So the two software is open source and you can get access to source code on the GitHub and another motivation is I would like to provide a new inspiration for HTML5 developers to integrate semantic Web more actively.

Chrome Extension that composer 20 plus through JS and proposed by JS is based on the standardized Baby Stretch API.

Bigger things occur outside.
There is a two baby browser plugin which is tabulator and Piggy Bank.
Fitch provides easy user interface for general users to view edit collective personal semantic data and update semantic data with sending Sparkle update message.
However, those two development tools for exports over semantic web as you're so general user don't don't directly get benefits.
